main event: A circular object described as being similar to the bottom of a half moon was observed in the sky over Bridgeport, New York on February 27, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as circular like the bottom of a half moon, and moved slowly upwards and downwards.
The object was estimated to be at least as large as an airplane canopy and changed color from yellowish to greyish.
There was only one object observed, which seemed to be surrounded by clouds or smoke, giving a hazy, 'frothy' appearance.
The object was observed by two civilian witnesses driving a car, who initially thought it was the moon.
The object was observed for at least 5 minutes, moving somewhat towards the north before just vanishing.
sighted object: circular object similar to the bottom of a half moon
witnesses: two civilian witnesses in a car
